meanings.definition: Prepunches (verb): to punch holes in something before it is needed
meanings.sent1: She prepunches the papers for the binder.
meanings.sent2: He always prepunches the tickets for the event.
meanings.sent3: The teacher prepunches the worksheets to save time during class.
meanings.sent4: The tailor prepunches the fabric before sewing it together.
meanings.sent5: The gardener prepunches the soil for planting seeds.

meanings.definition: Prepunches (noun): holes that have been punched in advance
meanings.sent1: The binder is full of prepunches for easy organization.
meanings.sent2: She found a stack of prepunches in the drawer.
meanings.sent3: The prepunches in the paper made it easier to put in the binder.
meanings.sent4: The prepunches in the leather were perfectly aligned.
meanings.sent5: He collected the prepunches to use for his project.
